frame.name: Make_agreement_on_action
frame.definition:
<def-root>Two (or more) people (the <fen>Parties</fen>, also encodable as <fen>Party_1</fen> and <fen>Party_2</fen>) negotiate an agreement. Both sides are construed as making a commitment to assume an <fen>Obligation</fen>--the process is understood to be symmetrical or reciprocal. Instead of a specific mention of the <fen>Obligation</fen>, a <fen>Topic</fen> expression may be used to indicate the domain covered.
<ex>So far , <fex name="par1">we</fex> have <t>agreed</t><fex name="Obligation">to cede 100km of coastline to Kiribati</fex> . <fex name="par2">DNI</fex> </ex>
<ex>At common law, <fex name="pars">the parties</fex> could <m>make</m> an <fex name="med">oral</fex> <t>agreement</t> <fex name="obl">to submit a dispute to arbitration</fex> and such oral agreement would be valid.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Party_1
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e. agentive) party of the agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus <fen>Manner</fen> is construed to be that of <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.
<ex>On Monday, <fex name="par1">the airline</fex> reached a <t>deal</t> with the Canadian Auto Workers.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Party_2
FE.definition:
<def-root>The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or group of participants) in the agreement. It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with).
<ex>Mozilla Foundation has finally reached an <t>agreement</t> <fex name="par2">with America Online</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Obligation
FE.definition:
<def-root>An expression of the commitment made by the <fen>Parties</fen> .
<ex>The US and Russia have <t>agreed</t> <fex name="obl">to share early warning data on missile launches</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered.
<ex>Some types of alloy steel have been covered in the expiring <fex name="top">trade</fex> <t>agreement</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root>As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <fen>Medium</fen> of communication may be expressed. <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to record or negotiate the <fen>Obligation</fen>.
<ex>The parties made a <fex name="med">written</fex> <t>agreement</t> to arbitrate disputes arising in connection with the contract.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the act of making an agreement which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of either <fen>Party_1</fen> or <fen>Parties</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>I <fex name="man">readily</fex> <t>agreed</t> with her to end our wrestling match.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Parties
FE.definition:
<def-root>The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in making an agreement.
<ex><fex name="pars">The US and Russia</fex> have <t>agreed</t> to cooperate in destroying surplus portable anti-aircraft missiles.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Agreement occurs.<ex>The town coucil members reached an <t>agreement</t> <fex name="Place">at the City Hall plenary session</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Agreement occurs.<ex>The town coucil members finally reached an <t>agreement</t> <fex name="Place">at midnight</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a characteristic of the <fen>Obligation</fen>. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: agreement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a negotiated and typically legally binding arrangement.

lexUnit.name: deal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an agreement entered into by two or more parties for their mutual benefit

lexUnit.name: treaty.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A formal agreement between two or more nations governed by international law.
